profileText: A Representative from Massachusetts; born in Duxbury, Mass., May 6, 1748; attended public and private schools, and was graduated from Harvard College in 1769; engaged in mercantile pursuits in Kingston, Mass.; served in the Revolutionary Army as an aide to Gen. Artemas Ward in 1776; engineer under General Thomas in 1776 and 1777; brigadier general of militia in 1777; adjutant general of Massachusetts in 1778; moved to Portland, Maine (then a district of Massachusetts), in 1784 and became a land agent; served in the Massachusetts senate in 1792; elected to the Third Congress and reelected as a Federalist to the six succeeding Congresses (March 4, 1793-March 3, 1807); moved to Oxford County, Maine, in 1807 to survey and improve a large tract of land granted to him by the Government; died in Hiram, Oxford County, Maine, November 12, 1829; interment in the family cemetery at Wadsworth Hall.

researchRecord.description: Highlights of the collection include the letters of Peleg Wadsworth, and his son-in-law Stephen Longfellow, written to their families while they served as U.S. congressmen.

researchRecord.name: 1778 and 1781, 12 items.
researchRecord.description: Seven letters are to Peleg Wadsworth's wife Betsey (Elizabeth Bartlett Wadsworth), two are to other officers, and two are to him. Topics represented include prisoners of war in Maine, the Revolutionary War in Maine and Fort George (in Castine, Me.; at the time part of Massachusetts). A finding aid

researchRecord.name: 1784, 1 item.
researchRecord.description: A receipt from Peleg Wadsworth to John Allen of Turner, Me., for back taxes for the year 1784.

researchRecord.name: 1795, 1 item.
researchRecord.description: A letter from Peleg Wadsworth, to Samuel Bartlett. In the letter, Peleg Wadsworth writes about Jay's Treaty; Gen. Anthony Wayne's Indian victory; the need to assist Mrs. Samuel Bartlett to settle her affairs; and other matters.

researchRecord.name: In the Maine Militia Records, 1822-1838, amount unknown.
researchRecord.description: Military papers of Peleg Wadsworth consisting of correspondence, regimental records, orders, and annual returns of Second Regiment of Infantry, Second Brigade, Sixth Division of the Maine Infantry; and constitution of Hiram Light Infantry Company.
